benchmark_details.name: Korean-Specific Dataset for Table Question Answering
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces two Korean-specific datasets for the task of table question answering: Korean Wikipedia Tabular dataset and Korean Wikipedia Table Questions dataset, along with a pre-trained language model called KO-TaBERT.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To construct datasets for Korean table question answering and train a corresponding pre-trained language model (KO-TaBERT).

data.source: Korean Wikipedia dump and crowdsourced workers for question-answering data.
data.size: 1.4M tables and 70k pairs of questions and answers
data.annotation: Generated by crowdsourced workers considering various levels of question difficulty.

methodology.calculation: EM is calculated if the predicted answer matches the ground truth exactly; F1 Score calculates token overlaps between predicted and ground truth answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher EM and F1 scores indicate better performance in answering the questions correctly.
methodology.validation: Evaluated on a test dataset consisting of subsets from KorQuAD 2.0 and the crowdsourced dataset.
